t: Woe*pn to you who*i are*i at ease in Zion, And*ld trust in Mount Samaria, Notable*ld persons in the chief nation, To*ld whom the house of Israel comes!

Go*ld over to Calneh and see; And*ld from there go to Hamath the great; Then*ld go down to Gath of the Philistines. Are*ild you*i better than these kingdoms? Or*ld is their territory greater than your territory?
Woe*iln to*i you who put far off the day of doom, Who*ld cause the seat of violence to come near;
Who*ld lie on beds of ivory, Stretch*ld out on your couches, Eat*ld lambs from the flock And*ld calves from the midst of the stall;
Who*ld sing idly to the sound of stringed instruments, And*ild invent for yourselves musical instruments like David;
Who*ld drink wine from bowls, And*ld anoint yourselves with the best ointments, But*ld are not grieved for the affliction of Joseph.
Therefore*ld they shall now go captive as the first of the captives, And*ld those who recline at banquets shall be removed.
The*ln Lord God*s has sworn by Himself, The*ld Lord*s God of hosts says: “I*ld abhor the pride of Jacob, And*ld hate his palaces; Therefore*ld I will deliver up the*i city And*ld all that is in it.”
Then*p it shall come to pass, that if ten men remain in one house, they shall die.

And when a relative of*i the*i dead,*i with one who will burn the*i bodies,*i picks up the bodies to take them out of the house, he will say to one inside the house, “Are*i there*i any more with you?” Then*p someone will say, “None.” And*p he will say, “Hold your tongue! For we dare not mention the name of the Lord.”*s
For*pn behold, the Lord*s gives a command: He*ld will break the great house into bits, And*ld the little house into pieces.
Do*ln horses run on rocks? Does*ld one*i plow there*i with oxen? Yet*ld you have turned justice into gall, And*ld the fruit of righteousness into wormwood,
You*ld who rejoice over Lo Debar, Who*ld say, “Have we not taken Karnaim for ourselves By*ld our own strength?”

“But,*ln behold, I will raise up a nation against you, O*ld house of Israel,” Says*ld the Lord*s God of hosts; “And*ld they will afflict you from the entrance of Hamath To*ld the Valley of the Arabah.”
